oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Received at Nashville, Tennessee, blanks for 3rd Brigade

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Richards, Edward Stone, 1840-1906; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Regimental histories -- Army of the Cumberland; United States -- Army -- Order-books
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: List of blanks (blank forms and books) received in Nashville for the use of the 3rd Brigade, 4th Cavalry Division, Army of the Cumberland, April 23, 1864.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Edward Stone Richards was a Lieutenant and Acting Assistant Adjutant General for 3rd Brigade, 4th Cavalry Division, Army of the Cumberland. One can see that during the Civil War, the use of printed forms greatly increased the consistency with which information was expressed. But, there are examples of hand-drawn forms on both sides.
